briefdescription.para: Different pool sizes: small, medium, large, and the backup malloc.
System construction of the pool component.
Get the name of the component.
Allocate some number of bytes plus extra size at the end.
Decided which pool bucket to target based on size.

simplesect.para: enum ePoolSize of which pool to target

briefdescription.para: Get remaining bytes for a pool allocation.

detaileddescription.para: using the memory pool, often extra bytes are at the end of the allocation because the user did not request the whole block assigned. Some components use this extra memory to pack in extra meta-data (or send serialized data) when sending a message.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer allocated from the pool

briefdescription.para: Get total allocated bytes for a pool allocation.

detaileddescription.para: result of this includes both the requested and oversize bytes.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer allocated from the pool

simplesect.para: the total number of allocated bytes

briefdescription.para: Attempt to increase the size of an allocation without reallocating.

detaileddescription.para: allocation will only be grown if grow_amount is less than or equal to the remaining size in the allocated block. If the grow_amount is too large, this function will return false and the allocation size will not be increased. On success, the new size will be reflected in the allocatedSize of the buffer.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer allocated from the pool that should be grown
the amount to grow the buffer

simplesect.para: false if the grow_amount is too large for the allocated block, true if the operation succeeded

briefdescription.para: Whether the pool is enabled at compile-time.
Whether the pool is enabled at compile-time and used as the default allocator for messages.
Attempt allocation via pooled allocator and fall back to standard allocation if it fails.

simplesect.para: a pointer to memory if succeeds
whether it succeeded or wasn't allocated by the pool

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t const &num_bytes, size_t const &oversize, ePoolSize const pool_type)
memberdef.name: pooledAlloc

briefdescription.para: Allocate memory from a specific pool.

parameterdescription.para: the pool to target of sufficient size

briefdescription.para: A core VT component that manages efficient pools of memory for quick allocation/deallocation.

detaileddescription.para: Highly efficient memory pool that is not thread-safe. Utilizes fixed-size buckets with free-list to quickly allocate and de-allocate.
